block.text: Ey övladlarım! Az bir müddәt dә sizinlә olacağam. Siz Mәni axtaracaqsınız. Yәhudilәrә “Mәnim getdiyim yerә siz gәlә bilmәzsiniz” dediyim kimi indi sizә dә bunu söylәyirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another, just like I have loved you; that you also love one another.

block.text: Sizә yeni bir әmr verirәm: bir-birinizi sevin, Mәn sizi sevdiyim kimi siz dә bir-birinizi sevin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.”

block.text: Әgәr bir-birinizә mәhәbbәtiniz olsa, bütün insanlar bilәcәk ki, siz Mәnim şagirdlәrimsiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter said to him,

block.text: Şimon Peter İsadan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, where are you going?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, hara gedirsәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: İsa cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where I am going, you can’t follow now, but you will follow afterwards.”

block.text: <<Getdiyim yerә indi ardımca gәlә bilmәzsәn, amma sonra ardımca gәlәcәksәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said to him,

block.text: Peter Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, niyә indi ardınca gәlә bilmәrәm? Sәnin üçün canımı qurban verәrәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Will you lay down your life for me? Most certainly I tell you, the rooster won’t crow until you have denied me three times.”

block.text: <<Mәnim üçün canını qurban verәrsәnmi? Doğrusunu, doğrusunu sәnә deyirәm: xoruz banlamazdan әvvәl sәn Mәni üç dәfә inkar edәcәksәn.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN 14
“Don’t let your heart be troubled. Believe in God. Believe also in me.

block.text: Qoy ürәyiniz tәlaşa düşmәsin. Allaha iman edin, Mәnә dә iman edin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In my Father’s house are many rooms. If it weren’t so, I would have told you. I am going to prepare a place for you.

block.text: Atamın evindә çoxlu mәskәn var. Әgәr olmasaydı, sizә deyәrdimmi ki, sizin üçün yer hazırlamağa gedirәm?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again, and will receive you to myself; that where I am, you may be there also.

block.text: Gedib sizin üçün yer hazırlayandan sonra yenә gәlib sizi Öz yanıma götürәcәyәm ki, Mәnim olduğum yerdә siz dә olasınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You know where I am going, and you know how to get there.”

block.text: Gedәcәyim yerә aparan yolu tanıyırsınız>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thomas said to him,

block.text: Tomas İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. How can we know the way?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, hara gedәcәyini bilmirik, yolu necә tanıya bilәrik?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father, except through me.

block.text: <<Yol, hәqiqәt vә hәyat Mәnәm. Mәnim vasitәm olmadan heç kim Atanın yanına gәlә bilmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you had known me, you would have known my Father also. From now on, you know him, and have seen him.”

block.text: Әgәr Mәni tanısaydınız, Atamı da tanıyardınız. İndidәn siz Onu tanıyırsınız, Onu görmüsünüz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip said to him,

block.text: Filip Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, show us the Father, and that will be enough for us.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, Atanı bizә göstәr, bu bizim üçün kifayәtdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have I been with you such a long time, and do you not know me, Philip? He who has seen me has seen the Father. How do you say, ‘Show us the Father?’

block.text: <<Xeyli müddәtdir ki, Mәn sizinlәyәm, Mәni tanımadınmı, Filip? Mәni görәn, Atanı görmüş olur. Bәs sәn niyә “Atanı bizә göstәr” deyirsәn?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t you believe that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? The words that I tell you, I speak not from myself; but the Father who lives in me does his works.

block.text: Mәnim Atada, Atanın da Mәndә olduğuna inanmırsanmı? Sizә söylәdiyim sözlәri Özümdәn söylәmirәm, Mәndә olan Ata Öz işlәrini görür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me; or else believe me for the very works’ sake.

block.text: Mәn Atadayam, Ata da Mәndәdir, bu sözümә inanın. Heç olmasa o işlәrә görә inanın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, he who believes in me, the works that I do, he will do also; and he will do greater works than these, because I am going to my Father.

block.text: Doğrusunu, doğrusunu sizә deyirәm: Mәnә iman edәn şәxs Mәnim etdiyim işlәri özü dә edәcәk, hәtta bunlardan da artığını edәcәk. Çünki Mәn Atanın yanına gedirәm

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whatever you will ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

block.text: vә Mәnim adımla hәr nә dilәsәniz, onu edәcәyәm ki, Ata Oğulda izzәtlәnsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you will ask anything in my name, I will do it.

block.text: Әgәr Mәnim adımla Mәndәn bir şey dilәsәniz, onu edәcәyәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you love me, keep my commandments.

block.text: Әgәr Mәni sevirsinizsә, әmrlәrimә riayәt edәcәksiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will pray to the Father, and he will give you another Comforter, that he may be with you forever.

block.text: Mәn dә Atadan xahiş edәcәyәm vә O sizә başqa bir Vәsatәtçi göndәrәcәk ki, daim sizinlә olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He is the Spirit of truth, whom the world can’t receive; for it doesn’t see him, neither knows him. You know him, for he lives with you, and will be in you.

block.text: O, hәqiqәt Ruhudur. Onu dünya qәbul edә bilmәz, çünki Onu nә görür, nә dә tanıyır. Sizsә Onu tanıyırsınız, çünki sizinlә qalır vә daxilinizdә olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will not leave you orphans. I will come to you.

block.text: Sizi yetim qoymaram, yanınıza gәlәcәyәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yet a little while, and the world will see me no more; but you will see me. Because I live, you will live also.

block.text: Az bir müddәtdәn sonra dünya daha Mәni görmәyәcәk, amma siz Mәni görәcәksiniz. Mәn yaşadığım üçün siz dә yaşayacaqsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that day you will know that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I in you.

block.text: O gün bilәcәksiniz ki, Mәn Atamdayam, siz Mәndәsiniz vә Mәn sizdәyәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One who has my commandments, and keeps them, that person is one who loves me. One who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him, and will reveal myself to him.”

block.text: Kim әmrlәrimә bağlı qalıb onlara riayәt edirsә, Mәni sevәn odur. Mәni sevәni Atam sevәcәk. Mәn dә onu sevib Özümü ona zahir edәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judas (not Iscariot) said to him,

block.text: İskaryot deyil, o biri Yәhuda Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, what has happened that you are about to reveal yourself to us, and not to the world?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, necә olacaq ki, Özünü dünyaya deyil, bizә zahir edәcәksәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: İsa ona cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If a man loves me, he will keep my word. My Father will love him, and we will come to him, and make our home with him.

block.text: <<Kim Mәni sevsә, sözümә riayәt edәr, Atam da onu sevәr vә Biz onun yanına gәlib onunla mәskәn salarıq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who doesn’t love me doesn’t keep my words. The word which you hear isn’t mine, but the Father’s who sent me.

block.text: Mәni sevmәyәnsә sözlәrimә riayәt etmәz. Eşitdiyiniz söz Mәnim deyil, Mәni göndәrәn Atanın sözüdür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have said these things to you, while still living with you.

block.text: Hәlә yanınızda qalarkәn sizә bu sözlәri söylәdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Counselor, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he will teach you all things, and will remind you of all that I said to you.

block.text: Lakin Vәsatәtçi – Atanın Mәnim adımla göndәrәcәyi Müqәddәs Ruh hәr şeyi sizә öyrәdәcәk vә söylәdiyim bütün sözlәri yadınıza salacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peace I leave with you. My peace I give to you; not as the world gives, give I to you. Don’t let your heart be troubled, neither let it be fearful.

block.text: Aranızda sülh qoyub gedirәm, Öz sülhümü sizә verirәm. Mәn onu sizә dünyanın verdiyi kimi vermirәm. Qoy ürәyiniz tәlaşa düşmәsin vә qorxmayın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You heard how I told you, ‘I go away, and I come to you.’ If you loved me, you would have rejoiced, because I said ‘I am going to my Father;’ for the Father is greater than I.

block.text: Sizә “indi gedirәm, sonra yenә yanınıza gәlәcәyәm” söylәdiyimi eşitdiniz. Әgәr Mәni sevsәydiniz, Atanın yanına gedәcәyimә sevinәrdiniz, çünki Ata Mәndәn üstündür.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now I have told you before it happens so that, when it happens, you may believe.

block.text: Bunu indi öncәdәn sizә söylәdim ki, baş verәndә buna inanasınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will no more speak much with you, for the prince of the world comes, and he has nothing in me.

block.text: Daha sizinlә çox danışmayacağam, çünki bu dünyanın hökmdarı gәlir. Onun Mәnim üzәrimdә heç bir sәlahiyyәti yoxdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father commanded me, even so I do. Arise, let us go from here.”

block.text: Ancaq dünya bilmәlidir ki, Mәn Atanı sevirәm vә Ata Mәnә nә әmr etdisә, ona әmәl edirәm. İndi isә qalxın buradan gedәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN 15
“I am the true vine, and my Father is the farmer.

block.text: Mәn hәqiqi Meynәyәm, Atam da Bağbandır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Every branch in me that doesn’t bear fruit, he takes away. Every branch that bears fruit, he prunes, that it may bear more fruit.

block.text: Mәndә olub bәhrә vermәyәn hәr budağı Atam qoparır. Bәhrә verәn hәr budağı isә budayıb tәmizlәyir ki, daha çox bәhrә versin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are already pruned clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.

block.text: Sizә söylәdiyim söz sayәsindә siz artıq tәmizsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Remain in me, and I in you. As the branch can’t bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you, unless you remain in me.

block.text: Mәndә qalın, Mәn dә sizdә qalım. Budaq meynәdә qalmasa, özündәn bәhrә vermәdiyi kimi siz dә Mәndә qalmasanız, bәhrә verә bilmәzsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am the vine. You are the branches. He who remains in me, and I in him, the same bears much fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.

block.text: Meynә Mәnәm, sizsә budaqlarsınız. Kim Mәndә qalsa, Mәn dә onda qalsam, çoxlu bәhrә verәr, çünki Mәnsiz heç nә edә bilmәzsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If a man doesn’t remain in me, he is thrown out as a branch, and is withered; and they gather them, throw them into the fire, and they are burned.

block.text: Kim Mәndә qalmasa, budaq kimi kәnara atılıb quruyar. Belә budaqlar yığılıb oda atılaraq yanar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you remain in me, and my words remain in you, you will ask whatever you desire, and it will be done for you.”

block.text: Әgәr Mәndә qalsanız vә sözlәrim sizdә qalsa, nә istәyirsinizsә, onu dilәyin, sizә verilәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “In this is my Father glorified, that you bear much fruit; and so you will be my disciples.

block.text: Sizin çoxlu bәhrә verәrәk Mәnim şagirdlәrim olmağınızla Atam izzәtlәnir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even as the Father has loved me, I also have loved you. Remain in my love.

block.text: Ata Mәni sevdiyi kimi Mәn dә sizi sevdim. Mәnim mәhәbbәtimdә qalın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you keep my commandments, you will remain in my love; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and remain in his love.

block.text: Әgәr әmrlәrimә riayәt etsәniz, Mәnim mәhәbbәtimdә qalacaqsınız, necә ki Mәn Atamın әmrlәrinә riayәt edәrәk Onun mәhәbbәtindә qalıram.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have spoken these things to you, that my joy may remain in you, and that your joy may be made full.”

block.text: Bu sözlәri sizә söylәdim ki, sevincim sizdә olsun vә sevinciniz kamil olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my commandment, that you love one another, even as I have loved you.

block.text: Mәnim әmrim belәdir: Mәn sizi sevdiyim kimi siz dә bir-birinizi sevin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.

block.text: Heç kәsin mәhәbbәti dostları uğrunda canını qurban verәn adamın mәhәbbәtindәn üstün ola bilmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are my friends, if you do whatever I command you.

block.text: Әgәr sizә әmr etdiyim şeylәrә әmәl etsәniz, siz Mәnim dostlarımsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No longer do I call you servants, for the servant doesn’t know what his lord does. But I have called you friends, for everything that I heard from my Father, I have made known to you.

block.text: Artıq sizә qul demirәm, çünki qul ağasının nә etdiyini bilmir. Mәn sizә dost deyirәm, çünki Atamdan eşitdiyim bütün sözlәri sizә bildirdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You didn’t choose me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that you should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should remain; that whatever you will ask of the Father in my name, he may give it to you.”

block.text: Siz Mәni seçmәdiniz, Mәn sizi seçib tәyin etdim ki, gedib bәhrә verәsiniz vә bәhrәniz çox qalsın. Belәcә Mәnim adımla Atadan nә dilәyirsinizsә, O sizә verәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I command these things to you, that you may love one another.

block.text: Belәliklә, sizә әmr edirәm: bir-birinizi sevin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If the world hates you, you know that it has hated me before it hated you.

block.text: Әgәr dünya sizә nifrәt edәrsә, onda yada salın ki, sizdәn әvvәl Mәnә nifrәt edib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you were of the world, the world would love its own. But because you are not of the world, since I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

block.text: Әgәr dünyadan olsaydınız, dünya özündәn olan sizlәri sevәrdi. Amma siz dünyadan deyilsiniz, Mәn sizi dünyadan seçdim, buna görә dünya sizә nifrәt edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Remember the word that I said to you: ‘A servant is not greater than his lord.’ If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they kept my word, they will keep yours also.

block.text: Mәnim sizә söylәdiyim sözü yadınıza salın: “Qul ağasından üstün deyil”. Әgәr Mәni tәqib etdilәrsә, sizi dә tәqib edәcәklәr, Mәnim sözümә riayәt etdilәrsә, sizin dә sözünüzә riayәt edәcәklәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But all these things will they do to you for my name’s sake, because they don’t know him who sent me.

block.text: Lakin bunların hamısını sizә Mәnim adıma görә edәcәklәr, çünki Mәni Göndәrәni tanımırlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

block.text: Әgәr gәlib onlara söylәmәsәydim, günahları olmazdı, ancaq indi günahları üçün bәhanәlәri yoxdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who hates me, hates my Father also.

block.text: Mәnә nifrәt edәn Atama da nifrәt edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I hadn’t done among them the works which no one else did, they wouldn’t have had sin. But now have they seen and also hated both me and my Father.

block.text: Әgәr Mәndәn başqa heç kәsin etmәdiyi işlәri onların arasında etmәsәydim, günahları olmazdı. Ancaq indi Mәnim nә etdiyimi gördülәr, hәm Mәnә, hәm dә Atama nifrәt etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But this happened so that the word may be fulfilled which was written in their law, ‘They hated me without a cause.’”

block.text: Lakin bu ona görә baş verdi ki, öz Qanunlarında yazılan “Mәnә nahaqdan nifrәt etdilәr” sözü yerinә yetsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When the Counselor has come, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, who proceeds from the Father, he will testify about me.

block.text: Atadan sizә göndәrәcәyim Vәsatәtçi – Atanın yanından çıxan hәqiqәt Ruhu gәldiyi zaman Mәnim barәmdә şәhadәt edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will also testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.”

block.text: Siz dә şәhadәt edәcәksiniz, çünki başlanğıcdan Mәnimlә birlikdәsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN 16
“These things have I spoken to you, so that you wouldn’t be caused to stumble.

block.text: Büdrәmәyәsiniz deyә bunları sizә söylәdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will put you out of the synagogues. Yes, the time comes that whoever kills you will think that he offers service to God.

block.text: Sizi sinaqoqlardan qovacaqlar. Hәtta o zaman gәlir ki, sizi öldürәn hәr kәs Allaha xidmәt etdiyini zәnn edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will do these things because they have not known the Father, nor me.

block.text: Onlar bunları edәcәk, çünki nә Atanı, nә dә Mәni tanıdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I have told you these things, so that when the time comes, you may remember that I told you about them. I didn’t tell you these things from the beginning, because I was with you.

block.text: İndi bu şeylәri sizә bildirdim ki, vaxtı gәlәndә sizә söylәdiyimi yada salasınız. Әvvәldәn bunları sizә söylәmәdim, çünki sizinlә birlikdә idim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now I am going to him who sent me, and none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’

block.text: İndi isә Mәni Göndәrәnin yanına gedirәm vә heç biriniz Mәndәn “Hara gedirsәn?” deyә soruşmur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.

block.text: Amma sizә bu şeylәri söylәdiyim üçün ürәyiniz kәdәrlә doldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is to your advantage that I go away, for if I don’t go away, the Counselor won’t come to you. But if I go, I will send him to you.

block.text: Bununla belә, Mәn sizә hәqiqәti söylәyirәm: Mәnim getmәyim sizin xeyrinizәdir. Çünki getmәsәm, Vәsatәtçi yanınıza gәlmәz, amma getsәm, Onu sizә göndәrәcәyәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he has come, he will convict the world about sin, about righteousness, and about judgment;

block.text: O gәlәndә günah, salehlik vә mühakimә barәdә dünyanı ifşa edәcәk:

ReferenceBlocks.text: about sin, because they don’t believe in me;

block.text: günah barәdә, çünki Mәnә iman etmirlәr;

ReferenceBlocks.text: about righteousness, because I am going to my Father, and you won’t see me any more;

block.text: salehlik barәdә, çünki Atanın yanına gedirәm vә daha Mәni görmәyәcәksiniz;

ReferenceBlocks.text: about judgment, because the prince of this world has been judged.”

block.text: mühakimә barәdә, çünki bu dünyanın hökmdarı mühakimә olunub.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have yet many things to tell you, but you can’t bear them now.

block.text: Hәlә sizә söylәnәcәk çoxlu sözüm var, amma indi bunlar ağlınıza sığmaz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However when he, the Spirit of truth, has come, he will guide you into all truth, for he will not speak from himself; but whatever he hears, he will speak. He will declare to you things that are coming.

block.text: Lakin O – hәqiqәt Ruhu gәlәndә sizә hәr hәqiqәtә yol göstәrәcәk. Çünki heç nәyi Özündәn söylәmәyәcәk, nә eşidirsә, onu söylәyәcәk vә gәlәcәyi sizә bildirәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will glorify me, for he will take from what is mine, and will declare it to you.

block.text: O Mәni izzәtlәndirәcәk, çünki Mәnim olandan götürüb sizә bildirәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things whatever the Father has are mine; therefore I said that he takes of mine, and will declare it to you.

block.text: Atanın hәr nәyi varsa, Mәnimdir. Buna görә dә “Mәnim olandan götürüb sizә bildirәcәk” söylәdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A little while, and you will not see me. Again a little while, and you will see me, because I go to the Father.”

block.text: Az bir müddәtdәn sonra Mәni artıq görmәyәcәksiniz, az bir müddәtdәn dә sonra Mәni yenә görәcәksiniz.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of his disciples therefore said to one another,

block.text: O vaxt İsanın bәzi şagirdlәri bir-birinә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is this that he says to us, ‘A little while, and you won’t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me;’ and, ‘Because I go to the Father?’”

block.text: <<“Az bir müddәtdәn sonra Mәni görmәyәcәksiniz, az bir müddәtdәn dә sonra yenә görәcәksiniz” vә “çünki Atanın yanına gedirәm” sözlәrinin mәnası nәdir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said therefore,

block.text: Öz aralarında soruşurdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What does he mean by, ‘A little while?’ We don’t know what he is saying.”

block.text: <<Söylәdiyi “az bir müddәt” nә demәkdir? Nә dediyini anlamırıq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask him, and he said to them,

block.text: İsa Ondan soruşmaq istәdiklәrini bilib onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, ‘A little while, and you won’t see me, and again a little while, and you will see me?’

block.text: <<“Az bir müddәtdәn sonra Mәni görmәyәcәksiniz, az bir müddәtdәn dә sonra yenә görәcәksiniz” sözüm barәdәmi bir-birinizdәn soruşursunuz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, that you will weep and lament, but the world will rejoice. You will be sorrowful, but your sorrow will be turned into joy.

block.text: Doğrusunu, doğrusunu sizә deyirәm: siz ağlayıb nalә çәkәcәksiniz, dünya isә sevinәcәk; siz kәdәrlәnәcәksiniz, amma kәdәriniz sevincә dönәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A woman, when she gives birth, has sorrow, because her time has come. But when she has delivered the child, she doesn’t remember the anguish any more, for the joy that a human being is born into the world.

block.text: Qadın doğuş zamanı kәdәrlәnәr, çünki vaxtı çatıb. Amma uşağı doğandan sonra dünyaya bir insan gәtirmәyinin sevincinә görә çәkdiyi ağrını yaddan çıxarar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore you now have sorrow, but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.”

block.text: Belәcә siz dә indi kәdәrlisiniz. Lakin Mәn sizi yenә görәcәyәm, onda ürәyiniz sevinәcәk vә heç kәs sevincinizi sizdәn ala bilmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “In that day you will ask me no questions. Most certainly I tell you, whatever you may ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you.

block.text: O gün Mәndәn heç nә soruşmayacaqsınız. Doğrusunu, doğrusunu sizә deyirәm: Mәnim adımla Atadan nә dilәyirsinizsә, O sizә verәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Until now, you have asked nothing in my name. Ask, and you will receive, that your joy may be made full.

block.text: İndiyә qәdәr Mәnim adımla heç nә dilәmәdiniz. Dilәyin, alacaqsınız, ta ki sevinciniz kamil olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have spoken these things to you in figures of speech. But the time is coming when I will no more speak to you in figures of speech, but will tell you plainly about the Father.

block.text: Sizә bu şeylәri mәsәllәrlә söylәdim. İndi elә bir zaman gәlir ki, daha mәsәllәrlә sizinlә danışmayacağam, amma Ata barәdә sizә açıq danışacağam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that day you will ask in my name; and I will not ask the Father for you.

block.text: O gün siz Mәnim adımla dilәyәcәksiniz. Mәn sizin barәnizdә Atadan bir şey xahiş edәcәyimi söylәmirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Father himself loves you because you have loved me, and have believed that I came forth from God.

block.text: Axı Ata Özü sizi sevir, çünki siz Mәni sevdiniz vә Mәnim Allahın yanından gәldiyimә inandınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I came out from the Father, and have come into the world. Again, I leave the world, and go to the Father.”

block.text: Atanın yanından dünyaya gәldim, yenә dünyanı tәrk edib Atanın yanına gedirәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples said to him,

block.text: Şagirdlәri dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, now you speak plainly, and speak no figures of speech.
Now we know that you know all things, and don’t need for anyone to question you. By this we believe that you came forth from God.”

block.text: <<Budur, indi açıq danışırsan, heç bir mәsәl söylәmirsәn.
İndi anlayırıq ki, Sәn hәr şeyi bilirsәn vә heç kәsin Sәndәn soruşmasına ehtiyacın yoxdur. Buna görә dә Allahdan gәldiyinә inanırıq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you now believe?
Behold, the time is coming, yes, and has now come, that you will be scattered, everyone to his own place, and you will leave me alone. Yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.

block.text: <<İndi inanırsınızmı?
Budur, hәr birinizin dağılıb öz evinә gedәcәyiniz vә Mәni tәk qoyacağınız vaxt gәlir vә artıq gәlib. Amma Mәn tәk deyilәm, çünki Ata Mәnimlәdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have told you these things, that in me you may have peace. In the world you have oppression; but cheer up! I have overcome the world.”

block.text: Mәndә sülhünüz olsun deyә bunları sizә söylәdim. Dünyada әziyyәtiniz var, amma cәsarәtli olun! Mәn dünyaya qalib gәldim>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN 17
Jesus said these things, and lifting up his eyes to heaven, he said,

block.text: İsa bunları söylәdikdәn sonra başını göyә qaldırıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son, that your Son may also glorify you.

block.text: <<Ey Ata, vaxt gәldi; Öz Oğlunu izzәtlәndir ki, Oğul da Sәni izzәtlәndirsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even as you gave him authority over all flesh, he will give eternal life to all whom you have given him.

block.text: Sәn Ona bütün bәşәr üzәrindә sәlahiyyәt verdin ki, Ona verdiyin şәxslәrin hamısına әbәdi hәyat versin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is eternal life, that they should know you, the only true God, and him whom you sent, Jesus Christ.

block.text: Әbәdi hәyat da budur ki, Sәni – yeganә hәqiqi Allahı vә göndәrdiyin İsa Mәsihi tanısınlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I glorified you on the earth. I have accomplished the work which you have given me to do.

block.text: Mәn yerinә yetirmәyi tapşırdığın işi tamamlamaqla Sәni yer üzündә izzәtlәndirdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now, Father, glorify me with your own self with the glory which I had with you before the world existed.

block.text: Ey Ata, dünya yaranmazdan әvvәl Mәn Sәnin yanında olarkәn malik olduğum izzәti indi Mәnә Öz yanında ver.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I revealed your name to the people whom you have given me out of the world. They were yours, and you have given them to me. They have kept your word.

block.text: Dünyadan Mәnә verdiyin adamlara Sәnin adını aşkar etdim. Onlar Sәninki idi. Sәn onları Mәnә verdin vә onlar Sәnin sözünә riayәt etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now they have known that all things whatever you have given me are from you.

block.text: İndi dә bilirlәr ki, Mәnә verdiyin bütün şeylәr Sәndәndir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the words which you have given me I have given to them, and they received them, and knew for sure that I came forth from you, and they have believed that you sent me.

block.text: Çünki Mәnә bildirdiyin sözlәri onlara bildirdim, onlar da qәbul etdi. Sәnin yanından çıxıb gәldiyimi әminliklә bildilәr vә Mәni Sәn göndәrdiyinә inandılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I pray for them. I don’t pray for the world, but for those whom you have given me, for they are yours.

block.text: Mәnim onlar üçün xahişim var. Dünya üçün deyil, Mәnә verdiyin kәslәr üçün xahişim var, çünki onlar Sәninkidir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things that are mine are yours, and yours are mine, and I am glorified in them.

block.text: Mәnim olan hәr şey Sәnindir, Sәnin şeylәrin dә Mәnimdir vә Mәn onlarda izzәtlәnmişәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them through your name which you have given me, that they may be one, even as we are.

block.text: Mәn artıq dünyada deyilәm, onlarsa dünyadadır vә Mәn Sәnin yanına gәlirәm. Ey Müqәddәs Ata, onları Mәnә verdiyin adınla qoru ki, Bizim kimi bir olsunlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While I was with them in the world, I kept them in your name. Those whom you have given me I have kept. None of them is lost, except the son of destruction, that the Scripture might be fulfilled.

block.text: Onlarla birlikdә olduğum zaman onları Mәnә verdiyin adınla qoruyurdum. Onları saxladım vә Müqәddәs Yazı yerinә yetsin deyә hәlaka gedәn adamdan başqa, onlardan heç biri hәlak olmadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But now I come to you, and I say these things in the world, that they may have my joy made full in themselves.

block.text: İndi isә Sәnin yanına gәlirәm. Dünyada ikәn bu sözlәri söylәyirәm ki, Mәnim sevincim onlarda kamil olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have given them your word. The world hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

block.text: Mәn onlara Sәnin sözünü verdim. Dünya isә onlara nifrәt etdi, çünki Mәn dünyadan olmadığım kimi onlar da dünyadan deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I pray not that you would take them from the world, but that you would keep them from the evil one.

block.text: Onları dünyadan götürmәyi deyil, şәr olandan qorumağı Sәndәn xahiş edirәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They are not of the world even as I am not of the world.

block.text: Mәn dünyadan olmadığım kimi onlar da dünyadan deyil.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Sanctify them in your truth. Your word is truth.
As you sent me into the world, even so I have sent them into the world.

block.text: Onları hәqiqәtlә tәqdis et. Sәnin sözün hәqiqәtdir.
Sәn Mәni dünyaya göndәrdiyin kimi Mәn dә onları dünyaya göndәrdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For their sakes I sanctify myself, that they themselves also may be sanctified in truth.

block.text: Mәn Özümü onların uğrunda tәqdis edirәm ki, onlar da hәqiqәtlә tәqdis olunsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not for these only do I pray, but for those also who believe in me through their word,

block.text: Yalnız onlar üçün deyil, onların sözü ilә Mәnә iman edәnlәr üçün dә xahiş edirәm ki,

ReferenceBlocks.text: that they may all be one; even as you, Father, are in me, and I in you, that they also may be one in us; that the world may believe that you sent me.

block.text: hamısı bir olsun. Ey Ata, Sәn Mәndә, Mәn dә Sәndә olduğum kimi onlar da Bizdә olsun ki, dünya Sәnin Mәni göndәrdiyinә inansın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The glory which you have given me, I have given to them; that they may be one, even as we are one;

block.text: Mәnә verdiyin izzәti Mәn dә onlara verdim ki, Biz bir olduğumuz kimi onlar da bir olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I in them, and you in me, that they may be perfected into one; that the world may know that you sent me, and loved them, even as you loved me.

block.text: Mәn onlarda, Sәn dә Mәndә olmaqla bütünlüklә bir olsunlar ki, dünya Sәnin Mәni göndәrdiyini, Mәni sevdiyin kimi onları da sevdiyini bilsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Father, I desire that they also whom you have given me be with me where I am, that they may see my glory, which you have given me, for you loved me before the foundation of the world.

block.text: Ey Ata, istәyirәm ki, Mәnә verdiyin şәxslәr dә Mәnim olduğum yerdә Mәnimlә birlikdә olub Mәnim izzәtimi görsünlәr. Bu izzәti dünya yaranmazdan әvvәl Mәni sevdiyin üçün Mәnә verdin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Righteous Father, the world hasn’t known you, but I knew you; and these knew that you sent me.

block.text: Ey әdalәtli Ata, dünya Sәni tanımadı, Mәnsә Sәni tanıdım, bunlar da Sәnin Mәni göndәrdiyini bildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I made known to them your name, and will make it known; that the love with which you loved me may be in them, and I in them.”

block.text: Sәnin adını onlara bildirdim vә yenә bildirәcәyәm ki, Sәnin Mәnә bәslәdiyin mәhәbbәt onlarda olsun, Mәn dә onlarda olum>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN 18
When Jesus had spoken these words, he went out with his disciples over the brook Kidron, where there was a garden, into which he and his disciples entered.

block.text: İsa bunları söylәdikdәn sonra şagirdlәri ilә birgә çıxıb Qidron vadisinin o biri tayına keçdi. Orada bir bağça var idi. İsa vә şagirdlәri oraya girdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Judas, who betrayed him, also knew the place, for Jesus often met there with his disciples.

block.text: Ona xәyanәt edәn Yәhuda da bu yeri tanıyırdı, çünki İsa tez-tez şagirdlәri ilә orada yığışırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judas then, having taken a detachment of soldiers and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.

block.text: Belәcә Yәhuda bir alay әsgәrlә başçı kahinlәrin vә fariseylәrin göndәrdiyi bәzi mühafizәçilәri götürüb çıraqlar, mәşәllәr vә silahlarla oraya gәldi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore, knowing all the things that were happening to him, went forth, and said to them,

block.text: İsa başına gәlәcәk hәr şeyi bildiyi üçün qabağa çıxdı vә deyә onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are you looking for?”

block.text: <<Kimi axtarırsınız?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Ona cavab verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus of Nazareth.”

block.text: <<Nazaretli İsanı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am he.”

block.text: <<Mәnәm>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judas also, who betrayed him, was standing with them.

block.text: Ona xәyanәt edәn Yәhuda da onlarla yanaşı idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore he said to them, “I am he,” they went backward, and fell to the ground.
Again therefore he asked them,

block.text: İsa onlara <<Mәnәm>> deyәndә geri çәkilib yerә qapandılar.
Onda yenә deyә onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who are you looking for?”

block.text: <<Kimi axtarırsınız?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onlar da dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus of Nazareth.”

block.text: <<Nazaretli İsanı>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: İsa cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I told you that I am he. If therefore you seek me, let these go their way,”

block.text: <<Sizә dedim ki, Mәnәm. Әgәr Mәni axtarırsınızsa, yanımdakıları buraxın getsinlәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that the word might be fulfilled which he spoke, “Of those whom you have given me, I have lost none.”

block.text: Bunu etdi ki, әvvәlcә dediyi <<Mәnә verdiyin şәxslәrin heç birini hәlak olmağa qoymadım>> sözü yerinә yetsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter therefore, having a sword, drew it, and struck the high priest's servant, and
cut off his right ear.

block.text: Şimon Peterin yanında qılınc var idi. Onu çәkib baş kahinin qulunu vuraraq
sağ qulağını kәsdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The servant’s name was Malchus.
Jesus therefore said to Peter,

block.text: O qulun adı Mәlik idi.
Onda İsa Peterә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Put the sword into its sheath. The cup which the Father has given me, shall I not surely drink it?”

block.text: <<Qılıncı qınına qoy! Atanın Mәnә verdiyi kasanı içmәyimmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the detachment, the commanding officer, and the officers of the Jews, seized Jesus and bound him.

block.text: Belәcә minbaşı ilә alay vә Yәhudi başçılarının mühafizәçilәri İsanı tutub әl-qolunu bağladılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They led him to Annas first, for he was father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.

block.text: Onu әvvәlcә Xananın yanına apardılar, çünki Xanan o il baş kahin olan Qayafanın qayınatası idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now it was Caiaphas who advised the Jews that it was expedient that one man should perish for the people.

block.text: Bu hәmin Qayafa idi ki, <<bir Adamın xalq uğrunda ölmәsi yaxşıdır>> deyә Yәhudi başçılarına mәslәhәt vermişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter followed Jesus, as did another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the high priest, and entered in with Jesus into the court of the high priest;

block.text: Şimon Peter vә başqa bir şagird İsanın ardınca gedirdi. Baş kahin o şagirdi tanıdığı üçün o, İsa ilә birlikdә baş kahinin hәyәtinә girdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but Peter was standing at the door outside. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought in Peter.

block.text: Peter isә bayırda qapının yanında durmuşdu. O vaxt baş kahinin tanıdığı hәmin şagird bayıra çıxıb qapıçı qızla danışdı vә Peteri içәri gәtirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the servant girl who kept the door said to Peter,

block.text: Bu arada qapıçı qız Peterdәn soruşdu:

block.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you also one of this man’s disciples?”

block.text: <<Yoxsa sәn dә bu Adamın şagirdlәrindәnsәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: O isә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am not.”

block.text: <<xeyr, deyilәm>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the servants and the officers were standing there, having made a fire of coals, for it was cold. They were warming themselves. Peter was with them, standing and warming himself.

block.text: Soyuq olduğu üçün qullar vә mühafizәçilәr orada ocaq qalamışdılar vә әtrafında dayanıb isinirdilәr. Peter dә onlarla yanaşı dayanıb isinirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The high priest therefore asked Jesus about his disciples, and about his teaching.
Jesus answered him,

block.text: O vaxt baş kahin İsadan şagirdlәri vә tәlimi barәdә soruşdu.
İsa ona cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I spoke openly to the world. I always taught in synagogues, and in the temple, where the Jews always meet. I said nothing in secret.

block.text: <<Mәn dünyaya açıq söylәmişәm, Yәhudilәrin hamısının toplaşdıqları sinaqoqlarda vә mәbәddә hәmişә tәlim öyrәdirdim, Mәn heç nәyi gizli söylәmәmişәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why do you ask me? Ask those who have heard me what I said to them. Behold, these know the things which I said.”

block.text: Niyә Mәndәn soruşursan? Nә dediyimi eşidәn adamlardan soruş. Axı onlar Mәnim söylәdiyim şeylәri bilir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, one of the officers standing by
slapped Jesus with his hand, saying,

block.text: İsa bu sözlәri söylәyәndәn sonra orada duran mühafizәçilәrdәn biri
deyib Ona bir şillә vurdu:

block.characterId: officials of high priest, one of the

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: officials of high priest, one of the
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you answer the high priest like that?”

block.text: <<Baş kahinә belәmi cavab verirsәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: İsa ona cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I have spoken evil, testify of the evil; but if well, why do you beat me?”

block.text: <<Әgәr haqsız danışdımsa, haqsız olduğunu sübut et. Әgәr doğru dedimsә, onda Mәni nә üçün vurursan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas, the high priest.

block.text: Xanan Onu әl-qolu bağlı halda baş kahin Qayafanın yanına göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said therefore to him,

block.text: Şimon Peter bayırda durub isinirdi. Ondan soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You aren’t also one of his disciples, are you?”

block.text: <<Yoxsa sәn dә Onun şagirdlәrindәnsәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He denied it, and said,

block.text: O inkar edib söylәdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am not.”

block.text: <<xeyr, deyilәm>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the servants of the high priest, being a relative of him whose ear Peter had cut off, said,

block.text: Baş kahinin qullarından biri Peterin vurub qulağını kәsdiyi adamın qohumu idi. Hәmin qul deyә Peterdәn soruşdu:

block.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Didn’t I see you in the garden with him?”

block.text: <<Sәni bağçada Onunla birlikdә görmәdimmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter therefore denied it again, and immediately the rooster crowed.

block.text: Peter yenә inkar etdi. Hәmin anda
xoruz banladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They led Jesus therefore from Caiaphas into the Praetorium. It was early, and they themselves didn’t enter into the Praetorium, that they might not be defiled, but might eat the Passover.

block.text: Sonra Yәhudi başçıları İsanı Qayafanın yanından vali sarayına apardılar. Sәhәr açılırdı. Amma özlәri vali sarayına girmәdilәr ki, murdar olmasınlar vә Pasxa yemәyini yeyә bilsinlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate therefore went out to them, and said,

block.text: Ona görә dә Pilat bayıra, onların yanına çıxıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What accusation do you bring against this man?”

block.text: <<Bu Adamı nәdә ittiham edirsiniz?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Onlar Pilata cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If this man weren’t an evildoer, we wouldn’t have delivered him up to you.”

block.text: <<Әgәr bu Adam cinayәtkar olmasaydı, Onu sәnә tәslim etmәzdik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate therefore said to them,

block.text: Pilat onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take him yourselves, and judge him according to your law.”

block.text: <<Onu siz götürüb öz Qanununuza görә mühakimә edin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Jews said to him,

block.text: Yәhudi başçıları Pilata dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death,”

block.text: <<Bizim heç kәsi edam etmәyә icazәmiz yoxdur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spoke, signifying by what kind of death he should die.

block.text: Onlar belә dedi ki, İsanın necә bir ölümlә ölәcәyinә işarә edәrәk söylәdiyi söz yerinә yetsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate therefore entered again into the Praetorium, called Jesus, and said to him,

block.text: Pilat yenә vali sarayına girdi, İsanı çağırıb Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the King of the Jews?”

block.text: <<Yәhudilәrin Padşahı Sәnsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered him,

block.text: İsa cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you say this by yourself, or did others tell you about me?”

block.text: <<Sәn bunu özündәnmi söylәyirsәn, yoxsa başqaları sәnә Mәnim barәmdә danışdı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate answered,

block.text: Pilat dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I’m not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and the chief priests delivered you to me. What have you done?”

block.text: <<Mәgәr mәn Yәhudiyәm? Sәni Öz millәtin vә başçı kahinlәr mәnә tәslim etdi. Söylә, nә etmisәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: İsa cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My Kingdom is not of this world. If my Kingdom were of this world, then my servants would fight, that I wouldn’t be delivered to the Jews. But now my Kingdom is not from here.”

block.text: <<Mәnim Padşahlığım bu dünyadan deyil. Әgәr Mәnim Padşahlığım bu dünyadan olsaydı, xidmәtçilәrim Yәhudi başçılarına tәslim edilmәmәyim üçün döyüşәrdi, amma indi Mәnim Padşahlığım buradan deyil>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate therefore said to him,

block.text: Pilat ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you a king then?”

block.text: <<Demәk, Sәn Padşahsan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: İsa cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You say that I am a king. For this reason I have been born, and for this reason I have come into the world, that I should testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to my voice.”

block.text: <<Sәnin dediyin kimi Mәn Padşaham. Mәn hәqiqәt barәdә şәhadәt etmәk üçün doğulub dünyaya gәldim. Hәqiqәtdәn olan hәr kәs Mәnim sәsimә qulaq asar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to him,

block.text: Pilat Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is truth?”

block.text: <<Hәqiqәt nәdir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he went out again to the Jews, and said to them,

block.text: Bunu deyәndәn sonra yenә bayıra, Yәhudilәrin yanına çıxıb onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I find no basis for a charge against him.

block.text: <<Mәn Onda heç bir tәqsir görmürәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you have a custom, that I should release someone to you at the Passover. Therefore do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”

block.text: Axı sizdә bir adәtdir ki, Pasxa zamanı mәn sizin üçün bir nәfәri azad edirәm. İndi istәyirsinizsә, sizin üçün Yәhudilәrin Padşahını azad edim?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they all shouted again, saying,

block.text: Bunun cavabında onlar yenә bağırıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Not this man, but Barabbas!”

block.text: <<Bu adamı yox, Barabbanı azad et!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now Barabbas was a robber.

block.text: Barabba isә bir quldur idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN 19
So Pilate then took Jesus, and flogged him.

block.text: Onda Pilat İsanı aparıb qamçılatdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The soldiers twisted thorns into a crown, and put it on his head, and dressed him in a purple garment.
They kept saying,

block.text: Әsgәrlәr dә tikandan bir tac hörüb Onun başına qoydular vә Ona tünd qırmızı paltar geyindirdilәr.
Onlar İsanın yanına gәlib

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hail, King of the Jews!”

block.text: <<Yәhudilәrin Padşahı sağ olsun!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and they kept slapping him.
Then Pilate went out again, and said to them,

block.text: deyirdilәr vә Ona şillә vururdular.
Pilat yenә bayıra çıxıb Yәhudilәrә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, I bring him out to you, that you may know that I find no basis for a charge against him.”

block.text: <<Budur, Onu bayıra, sizin yanınıza gәtirirәm ki, Onda bir tәqsir görmәdiyimi bilәsiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus therefore came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment. Pilate said to them,

block.text: O zaman İsa başında tikandan tac, әynindә tünd qırmızı paltar bayıra çıxdı. Pilat onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the man!”

block.text: <<O Adam budur!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw him, they shouted, saying,

block.text: Başçı kahinlәr vә mühafizәçilәr Onu gördükdә deyә bağırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Crucify! Crucify!”

block.text: <<Çarmıxa çәk, çarmıxa çәk!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to them,

block.text: Pilat onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take him yourselves, and crucify him, for I find no basis for a charge against him.”

block.text: <<Onu özünüz götürüb çarmıxa çәkin, çünki mәn Onda bir tәqsir görmürәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Jews answered him,

block.text: Yәhudilәr ona cavab verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have a law, and by our law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.”

block.text: <<Bizim bir qanunumuz var, bu qanuna görә O ölmәlidir, çünki Özünü Allahın Oğlu adlandırır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore Pilate heard this saying, he was more afraid.

block.text: Pilat bu sözü eşidәndә daha da qorxdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He entered into the Praetorium again, and said to Jesus,

block.text: Yenә vali sarayına girib İsadan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where are you from?”

block.text: <<Sәn haradansan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus gave him no answer.
Pilate therefore said to him,

block.text: Amma İsa ona cavab vermәdi.
Pilat Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Aren’t you speaking to me? Don’t you know that I have power to release you, and have power to crucify you?”

block.text: <<Mәnәmi cavab vermirsәn? Bilmirsәn ki, Sәni azad etmәyә yaxud çarmıxa çәkmәyә sәlahiyyәtim var?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered,

block.text: İsa ona cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You would have no power at all against me, unless it were given to you from above. Therefore he who delivered me to you has greater sin.”

block.text: <<Әgәr sәnә yuxarıdan verilmәsәydi, Mәnim üzәrimdә heç bir sәlahiyyәtin olmazdı. Buna görә dә Mәni sәnә tәslim edәnin günahı daha böyükdür>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At this, Pilate was seeking to release him, but the Jews cried out, saying,

block.text: Bundan sonra Pilat Onu azad etmәyә çalışdı, ancaq Yәhudilәr bağırıb dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you release this man, you aren’t Caesar’s friend! Everyone who makes himself a king speaks against Caesar!”

block.text: <<Әgәr bu Adamı azad etsәn, qeysәrin dostu deyilsәn. Kim özünü padşah elan edirsә, qeysәrә qarşı çıxmış olur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Pilate therefore heard these words, he brought Jesus out, and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called “The Pavement,” but in Hebrew, “Gabbatha.”

block.text: Pilat bu sözü eşitdikdә İsanı bayıra apardı vә ibranicә Qabbata, yәni Daş döşәmә deyilәn yerdә hökm kürsüsünә oturdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now it was the Preparation Day of the Passover, at about the sixth hour. He said to the Jews,

block.text: Pasxaya hazırlıq günü idi. Altıncı saat radәlәri idi. Pilat Yәhudilәrә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your King!”

block.text: <<Padşahınız budur!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cried out,

block.text: Amma onlar deyә bağırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!”

block.text: <<Yox, rәdd olsun, rәdd olsun! Onu çarmıxa çәk!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to them,

block.text: Pilat onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Shall I crucify your King?”

block.text: <<Padşahınızımı çarmıxa çәkim?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests answered,

block.text: Başçı kahinlәr cavab verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have no king but Caesar!”

block.text: <<Qeysәrdәn başqa padşahımız yoxdur!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then he delivered him to them to be crucified. So they took Jesus and led him away.

block.text: Onda Pilat İsanı çarmıxa çәkilmәk üçün onlara tәslim etdi. Әsgәrlәr İsanı götürüb apardılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went out, bearing his cross, to the place called “The Place of a Skull”, which is called in Hebrew, “Golgotha”.

block.text: İsa çarmıxını Özü daşıyaraq ibranicә Qolqota, yәni <<Kәllә yeri>> adlanan yerә çıxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There they crucified him, along with two others, one on either side, and Jesus in the middle.

block.text: Orada Onu vә başqa iki nәfәri çarmıxa çәkdilәr: biri İsanın sağında, o biri isә solunda idi, İsa da ortada idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate wrote a title also, and put it on the cross. There was written, “JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

block.text: Pilat bir lövhә yazıb onu çarmıxın üstündә asdırdı. Orada belә yazılmışdı: <<Yәhudilәrin Padşahı Nazaretli İsa>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek.

block.text: Yәhudilәrin bir çoxu bu lövhәni oxudu, çünki İsanın çarmıxa çәkildiyi yer şәhәrә yaxın idi vә lövhәdә ibranicә, latınca vә yunanca yazılmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests of the Jews therefore said to Pilate,

block.text: Bunu görüb Yәhudi başçı kahinlәri Pilata dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but, ‘he said, I am King of the Jews.’”

block.text: <<“Yәhudilәrin Padşahı” yox, “Özünü Yәhudilәrin Padşahı adlandıran” yaz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate answered,

block.text: Pilat cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What I have written, I have written.”

block.text: <<Nә yazdımsa, yazdım>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the soldiers, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also the coat.

block.text: Әsgәrlәr İsanı çarmıxa çәkdiklәri zaman Onun paltarlarını götürüb hәr әsgәr üçün bir pay olmaqla dörd hissәyә böldülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.
Then they said to one another,

block.text: Tikişsiz vә başdan-ayağa toxuma olan köynәyini götürdülәr.
Onlar bir-birinә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Let’s not tear it, but cast lots for it to decide whose it will be,”

block.text: <<Bunu cırmayaq, püşk ataq, görәk kimin olur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that the Scripture might be fulfilled, which says,

block.text: Müqәddәs Yazıdakı

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They parted my garments among them. For my cloak they cast lots.”

block.text: <<Aralarında paltarlarımı bölüşdürdülәr, Geyimim üçün püşk atdılar>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the soldiers did these things.

block.text: sözü yerinә yetsin deyә әsgәrlәr bunu etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But there were standing by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

block.text: İsanın çarmıxı yanında anası, anasının bacısı, Klopanın arvadı Mәryәm vә Mәcdәlli Mәryәm dayanmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when Jesus saw his mother, and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother,

block.text: İsa anasını vә onun yanında Öz sevimli şagirdinin dayandığını gördükdә anasına dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, behold your son!”

block.text: <<Ana, bu sәnin oğlundur!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to the disciple,

block.text: Sonra isә şagirdә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your mother!”

block.text: <<Bu da sәnin anandır!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: From that hour, the disciple took her to his own home.

block.text: Hәmin andan sonra şagird onu öz evinә apardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After this, Jesus, seeing that all things were now finished, that the Scripture might be fulfilled, said,

block.text: Daha sonra İsa hәr şeyin artıq tamam olduğunu bilәrәk Müqәddәs Yazı tam yerinә yetsin deyә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I am thirsty.”

block.text: <<Susadım!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now a vessel full of vinegar was set there; so they put a sponge full of the vinegar on hyssop, and held it at his mouth.

block.text: Orada şәrab sirkәsi ilә dolu bir qab qoyulmuşdu. Bir süngәri şәrab sirkәsinә batıraraq züfaya taxıb İsanın ağzına yaxınlaşdırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said,

block.text: İsa şәrab sirkәsini daddı. Sonra dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is finished.”

block.text: <<tamam oldu>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He bowed his head, and gave up his spirit.

block.text: vә başını әyib ruhunu tapşırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Jews, because it was the Preparation Day, so that the bodies wouldn’t remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a special one), asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

block.text: Hazırlıq günü olduğuna görә Yәhudi başçıları Pilatdan çarmıxa çәkilәnlәrin baldırlarının qırılmasını vә cәsәdlәrin götürülmәsini xahiş etdilәr. Onlar cәsәdlәrin Şәnbә günü çarmıxda qalmasını istәmirdilәr, çünki o Şәnbә günü böyük bir bayram idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the soldiers came, and broke the legs of the first, and of the other who was crucified with him;

block.text: Onda әsgәrlәr gәlib әvvәl İsa ilә çarmıxa çәkilәn bir adamın, sonra isә o biri adamın baldırlarını qırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was already dead, they didn’t break his legs.

block.text: İsanın yanına gәlәndә isә Onun artıq öldüyünü görüb baldırlarını qırmadılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: However one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.

block.text: Amma әsgәrlәrdәn biri Onun böyrünü nizә ilә deşdi, o anda oradan qan vә su axdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has seen has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he tells the truth, that you may believe.

block.text: Bunu görәn adam özü şәhadәt edir vә onun şәhadәti doğrudur, sizin dә iman etmәyiniz üçün hәqiqәti söylәdiyini bilir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For these things happened, that the Scripture might be fulfilled,

block.text: Bunlar ona görә oldu ki, Müqәddәs Yazıdakı sözü yerinә yetsin:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A bone of him will not be broken.”

block.text: <<Onun bir sümüyü dә qırılmayacaq>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again another Scripture says,

block.text: Yenә başqa bir Yazıda deyilir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They will look on him whom they pierced.”

block.text: <<bәdәnini deşdiklәri Şәxsә baxacaqlar>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After these things, Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked Pilate:

block.text: Bundan sonra, Cozef Arimathaea edən İsa gizli bir şagird idi, o, yəhudiləri qorxuram, çünki Pilate suallar:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May I take Jesus’ body for burial?”

block.text: "Mən May dəfn üçün İsanın orqanı almaq?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate gave him permission. He came therefore and took away his body.

block.text: Pilat ona izin verdi vә Yusif gәlib İsanın cәsәdini götürdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nicodemus, who at first came to Jesus by night, also came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred Roman pounds.

block.text: Vaxtı ilә gecә ikәn İsanın yanına gәlәn Nikodim dә gәlib yüz litraya qәdәr qarışıq mirra vә әzvay gәtirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So they took Jesus’ body, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.

block.text: İsanın cәsәdini götürüb Yәhudilәrin dәfn adәtinә uyğun olaraq әtirlәrlә birgә kәtan bezlәrә sarıdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden. In the garden was a new tomb in which no man had ever yet been laid.

block.text: İsanın çarmıxa çәkildiyi yerdә bir bağça, bu bağçanın içindә dә hәlә heç kәsin qoyulmadığı tәzә bir qәbir var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then because of the Jews’ Preparation Day (for the tomb was near at hand) they laid Jesus there.

block.text: Qәbir yaxında olduğuna görә İsanın cәsәdini oraya qoydular, çünki o gün Yәhudilәrin Hazırlıq günü idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN 20
Now on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene went early, while it was still dark, to the tomb, and saw the stone taken away from the tomb.

block.text: Hәftәnin ilk günü tezdәn, hәlә qaranlıq ikәn Mәcdәlli Mәryәm qәbirin yanına gәldi. O gördü ki, daş qәbirin ağzından götürülüb.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore she ran and came to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and said to them,

block.text: Onda qaçıb Şimon Peterlә İsanın sevimlisi olan o biri şagirdin yanına gәldi vә onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have laid him!”

block.text: <<Rәbbi qәbirdәn aparıblar vә hara qoyulduğunu bilmirik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Peter and the other disciple went out, and they went toward the tomb.

block.text: Peterlә o biri şagird bayıra çıxıb qәbirә tәrәf getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They both ran together. The other disciple outran Peter, and came to the tomb first.

block.text: İkisi birgә qaçırdı, amma o biri şagird Peterdәn daha cәld qaçdı vә qabaqca qәbirә o çatdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Stooping and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying, yet he didn’t enter in.

block.text: Әyilib içәri baxdı vә kәtan bezlәrin düşüb-qaldığını gördü, ancaq içәri girmәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and entered into the tomb. He saw the linen cloths lying,
and the cloth that had been on his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself.

block.text: O vaxt onun ardınca Şimon Peter dә gәlib qәbirә girdi. O, düşüb-qalan kәtan bezlәri
vә İsanın başına qoyulmuş dәsmalı gördü. Dәsmal kәtan bezlәrin yanında deyil, başqa bir yerdә bükülü qalmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So then the other disciple who came first to the tomb also entered in, and he saw and believed.

block.text: Onda qәbirin yanına qabaqca gәlәn o biri şagird dә içәri girib bunları gördü vә iman etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as yet they didn’t know the Scripture, that he must rise from the dead.

block.text: Çünki İsanın mütlәq ölülәr arasından dirilәcәyini bildirәn Müqәddәs Yazını onlar hәlә anlamırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So the disciples went away again to their own homes.

block.text: Belәcә şagirdlәr yenә evlәrinә qayıtdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Mary was standing outside at the tomb weeping. So, as she wept, she stooped and looked into the tomb,

block.text: Mәryәm isә ağlayaraq qәbirin bayırında dayanmışdı. Ağlaya-ağlaya әyilib qәbirin içinә baxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and she saw two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.
They told her,

block.text: Orada ağ paltar geymiş iki mәlәk gördü: biri İsanın cәsәdinin qoyulduğu yerin başında, o biri isә ayağında oturmuşdu.
Onlar Mәryәmdәn deyә soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, why are you weeping?”

block.text: <<Ey qadın, niyә ağlayırsan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She said to them,

block.text: Mәryәm dә onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because they have taken away my Lord, and I don’t know where they have laid him.”

block.text: <<Rәbbimi qәbirdәn aparıblar vә hara qoyduqlarını bilmirәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing, and didn’t know that it was Jesus.
Jesus said to her,

block.text: Bunu deyәndәn sonra arxaya dönüb İsanın orada dayandığını gördü, amma Onun İsa olduğunu bilmәdi.
İsa ondan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?”

block.text: <<Ey qadın, niyә ağlayırsan? Kimi axtarırsan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She, supposing him to be the gardener, said to him,

block.text: Mәryәm Onun bağban olduğunu güman edәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away.”

block.text: <<Ağa, әgәr Onu Sәn aparmısansa, hara qoyduğunu mәnә söylә, mәn dә Onu götürüm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to her,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Mary.”

block.text: <<Mәryәm!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: She turned and said to him,

block.text: O da dönüb İsaya ibranicә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Rabboni!”

block.text: <<Rabbuni!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: which is to say, “Teacher!”
Jesus said to her,

block.text: <<Rabbuni><Müәllim>> demәkdir.
İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t hold me, for I haven’t yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brothers, and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”

block.text: <<Mәnә toxunma, çünki Mәn hәlә Atanın yanına qalxmamışam. Amma qardaşlarımın yanına gedib onlara söylә: Öz Atamın – sizin Atanızın, Öz Allahımın – sizin Allahınızın yanına qalxıram>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Mary Magdalene came and told the disciples:

block.text: Mәcdәlli Mәryәm şagirdlәrin yanına gәldi, onlara

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have seen the Lord!”,

block.text: <<Rәbbi görmüşәm!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: and she told them what he had said to her.

block.text: deyib onun özünә bunları söylәdiyini bildirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When therefore it was evening, on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were locked where the disciples were assembled, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them,

block.text: O gün – hәftәnin ilk günü axşam çağı Yәhudi başçılarından qorxduqları üçün şagirdlәrin olduqları yerin qapıları bağlı olsa da, İsa içәri girdi. O ortada durub onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you.”

block.text: <<Sizә salam olsun!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad when they saw the Lord.
Jesus therefore said to them again,

block.text: Bunu söylәyib onlara әllәrini vә böyrünü göstәrdi. Şagirdlәr dә Rәbbi görüb sevindilәr.
İsa yenә onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you. As the Father has sent me, even so I send you.”

block.text: <<Sizә salam olsun! Ata Mәni göndәrdiyi kimi Mәn dә sizi göndәrirәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he breathed on them, and said to them,

block.text: Bunu söylәdikdәn sonra onların üzәrinә üfürәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Receive the Holy Spirit!
If you forgive anyone’s sins, they have been forgiven them. If you retain anyone’s sins, they have been retained.”

block.text: <<Müqәddәs Ruhu alın!
Kimin günahlarını bağışlasanız, bağışlanır, kimin günahlarını bağışlamasanız, bağışlanmamış qalır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, wasn’t with them when Jesus came.

block.text: Lakin On İki şagirddәn biri <<Әkiz>> adlanan Tomas İsa gәlәndә onların yanında deyildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The other disciples therefore said to him,

block.text: O biri şagirdlәr Tomasa

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We have seen the Lord!”

block.text: <<Rәbbi gördük>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: deyәndә onlara söylәdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.”

block.text: <<Әgәr Onun әllәrindә mıxların açdığı yaraları görmәsәm, mıxların yerinә barmağımla toxunmasam, böyrünә dә әlimi qoymasam, buna heç inanmaram>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After eight days again his disciples were inside, and Thomas was with them. Jesus came, the doors being locked, and stood in the midst, and said,

block.text: Sәkkiz gün sonra İsanın şagirdlәri yenә otaqda toplaşanda Tomas da onların yanında idi. Qapılar bağlı olsa da, İsa içәri girdi. O ortada durub dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you.”

block.text: <<Sizә salam olsun!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to Thomas,

block.text: Bundan sonra Tomasa söylәdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Reach here your finger, and see my hands. Reach here your hand, and put it into my side. Don’t be unbelieving, but believing.”

block.text: <<Barmağını buraya uzat, әllәrimә bax, әlini dә uzat, böyrümә qoy. İmansız olma, imanlı ol!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Thomas answered him,

block.text: Tomas cavab verib Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My Lord and my God!”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbbim vә Allahım!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Because you have seen me, you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen, and have believed.”

block.text: <<Sәn Mәni gördüyün üçünmü iman etdin? Görmәdәn iman edәnlәr nә bәxtiyardır!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book;

block.text: İsa şagirdlәrinin gözü önündә bir çox başqa әlamәtlәr dә göstәrdi ki, bu kitabda yazılmayıb.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but these are written, that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing you may have life in his name.

block.text: Amma buradakılar onun üçün yazılıb ki, siz İsanın Mәsih – Allahın Oğlu olduğuna inanasınız vә iman edәrәk Onun adı ilә hәyata malik olasınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: JOHN 21
After these things, Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias. He revealed himself this way.

block.text: Bu hadisәlәrdәn sonra İsa Tiberiya gölünün kәnarında yenә şagirdlәrә göründü. Bu belә oldu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter, Thomas called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples were together.
Simon Peter said to them,

block.text: Şimon Peter, <<Әkiz>>adlanan Tomas, Qalileyanın Qana kәndindәn olan Natanael, Zavdayın oğulları vә Onun başqa iki şagirdi birlikdә idi.
Şimon Peter onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I’m going fishing.”

block.text: <<balıq ovuna gedirәm>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: O birilәr dә ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We are also coming with you.”

block.text: <<biz dә sәninlә gedirik>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They immediately went out, and entered into the boat. That night, they caught nothing.

block.text: Onlar gedib qayığa mindilәr, amma o gecә bir şey tuta bilmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when day had already come, Jesus stood on the beach, yet the disciples didn’t know that it was Jesus.
Jesus therefore said to them,

block.text: Günәş doğarkәn İsa sahildә dayanmışdı, amma şagirdlәr Onun İsa olduğunu bilmәdilәr.
İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Children, have you anything to eat?”

block.text: <<Uşaqlar, yemәyә bir şey tutmusunuzmu?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Ona deyә cavab verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “No.”

block.text: <<xeyr>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa yenә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.”

block.text: <<Toru qayığın sağ tәrәfinә atın, orada tapacaqsınız>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They cast it therefore, and now they weren’t able to draw it in for the multitude of fish.

block.text: Elәcә dә atdılar vә o qәdәr balıq tutdular ki, toru çәkә bilmirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciple therefore whom Jesus loved said to Peter,

block.text: Onda İsanın sevimli şagirdi Peterә söylәdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It’s the Lord!”

block.text: <<Bu, Rәbdir>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he wrapped his coat around him (for he was naked), and threw himself into the sea.

block.text: Şimon Peter Onun Rәbb olduğunu eşidәn kimi әynindәn çıxartdığı üst paltarına bürünüb gölә atıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits away), dragging the net full of fish.

block.text: O biri şagirdlәr isә balıq torunu çәkә-çәkә qayıqda gәldilәr, çünki sahildәn uzaq deyildilәr, cәmi iki yüz qulac mәsafәdә idilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when they got out on the land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Onlar quruya çıxanda orada közәrmiş ocağı, onun üzәrinә qoyulmuş balığı vә yanında olan çörәyi gördülәr.
İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.”

block.text: <<İndi tutduğunuz balıqlardan gәtirin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fish, one hundred fifty-three; and even though there were so many, the net wasn’t torn.
Jesus said to them,

block.text: Şimon Peter qayığa minib yüz әlli üç böyük balıqla dolu toru quruya çәkdi. Balıq lap çox olsa da, tor yırtılmadı.
İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come and eat breakfast.”

block.text: <<Gәlin, sәhәr yemәyi yeyin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: None of the disciples dared inquire of him, “Who are you?” knowing that it was the Lord.

block.text: Şagirdlәrdәn heç biri Ondan <<Sәn kimsәn?>>deyә soruşmağa cәsarәt etmirdi, çünki Onun Rәbb olduğunu bilirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus came and took the bread, gave it to them, and the fish likewise.

block.text: İsa gәlib çörәyi götürdü vә onlara verdi, elәcә balığı da verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is now the third time that Jesus was revealed to his disciples, after he had risen from the dead.

block.text: İsa ölülәr arasından dirildikdәn sonra artıq üçüncü dәfә idi ki, şagirdlәrә görünürdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So when they had eaten their breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter,

block.text: Sәhәr yemәyindәn sonra İsa Şimon Peterә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me more than these?”

block.text: <<Ey Yәhya oğlu Şimon, Mәni bunlardan çox sevirsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: Peter ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.”

block.text: <<Bәli, ya Rәbb, Sәni sevdiyimi bilirsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Feed my lambs.”

block.text: <<Quzularımı bәslә>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him again a second time,

block.text: İkinci dәfә yenә Peterә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you love me?”

block.text: <<Ey Yәhya oğlu Şimon, Mәni sevirsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: O da İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.”

block.text: <<Bәli, ya Rәbb, Sәni sevdiyimi bilirsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tend my sheep.”

block.text: <<Quzularımı otar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him the third time,

block.text: Üçüncü dәfә Peterә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, son of Jonah, do you have affection for me?”

block.text: <<Ey Yәhya oğlu Şimon, Mәni sevirsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter was grieved because he asked him the third time, “Do you love me?” He said to him,

block.text: Peter üçüncü dәfә İsanın ona <<Mәni sevirsәnmi?>> sualını vermәyinә kәdәrlәndi vә Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, you know everything. You know that I love you!”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, Sәn hәr şeyi bilirsәn, Sәni sevdiyimi bilirsәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Feed my sheep.
Most certainly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to.

block.text: “Feed my sheep.
Most certainly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don’t want to go.”

block.text: But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don't want to go.”

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When he had said this, he said to him,

block.text: İsa bunu ona görә söylәdi ki, Peterin necә öz ölümü vasitәsilә Allahı izzәtlәndirәcәyinә işarә etsin. Bunu söylәdikdәn sonra ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me.”

block.text: <<ardımca gәl>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Peter, turning around, saw a disciple following. This was the disciple whom Jesus sincerely loved, the one who had also leaned on Jesus’ breast at the supper and asked, “Lord, who is going to betray You?”

block.text: Peter dә arxaya dönüb İsanın sevimli şagirdinin ardlarınca gәldiyini gördü. Bu hәmin şagird idi ki, axşam yemәyi zamanı İsanın sinәsinә әyilib <<Ya Rәbb, Sәnә xәyanәt edәcәk adam kimdir?>> demişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter seeing him, said to Jesus,

block.text: Peter bu şagirdi görüb İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, what about this man?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, bәs o necә olacaq?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you? You follow me.”

block.text: <<Әgәr Mәn gәlәnә qәdәr onun sağ qalmasını istәyirәmsә, bundan sәnә nә? Sәn ardımca gәl>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This saying therefore went out among the brothers, that this disciple wouldn’t die. Yet Jesus didn’t say to him that he wouldn’t die, but, “If I desire that he stay until I come, what is that to you?”

block.text: Belәcә o şagirdin ölmәyәcәyi barәdә imanlı bacı-qardaşlar arasında söz yayıldı. Amma İsa onun ölmәyәcәyini demәmişdi, sadәcә olaraq <<Әgәr Mәn gәlәnә qәdәr onun sağ qalmasını istәyirәmsә, bundan sәnә nә?>> demişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This is the disciple who testifies about these things, and wrote these things. We know that his witness is true.

block.text: Bu hadisәlәrә şәhadәt edәrәk bunları yazan hәmin şagirddir. Biz dә bilirik ki, onun şәhadәti etibarlıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There are also many other things which Jesus did, which if they would all be written, I suppose that even the world itself wouldn’t have room for the books that would be written.

block.text: İsanın etdiyi çoxlu başqa şeylәr dә var. Әgәr bunlar da bir-bir yazılsaydı, fikrimcә, yazılan kitablar heç dünyaya sığmazdı.
